cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the eastern Caribbean, forecast to skirt southern Hispaniola and Jamaica this weekend, cross or skirt Cuba on Monday, then curve north-northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the west-central Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along Florida’s west coast (Big Bend area – near or just north of Tampa Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Florida at this time – watches confined to portions of the Lesser Antilles, Hispaniola, Haiti and Jamaica
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in Florida at this time – warnings confined to Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent and Grenadines, Martinique, and the southern coast of Hispaniola
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west-central Florida coast from Naples northward through Cedar Key including Tampa Bay is inside the day-4/5 uncertainty cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph with higher gusts) could reach the Tampa Bay area late Tuesday night or early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Preliminary guidance supports 2–4 ft of surge in and near Tampa Bay if Elsa maintains tropical-storm intensity and arrives on a high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals possible, producing urban and low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands; hazardous seas hampering vessel operations in approach channels
